intro: Wendlandia merrilliana var. merrilliana, commonly known as the white-flowered wendlandia, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy beneath. It prefers cool, moist environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to the Campanulaceae family.
